alert.note: Alert for Crowley (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:43PM MDT until June 06 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CROWLEY AND EASTERN PUEBLO COUNTIES... At 343 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles northeast of Boone, or 31 miles east of Pueblo, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Crowley and eastern Pueblo Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
